int main() {

    int n, m;

    scanf("%d %d", &n, &m);

    // Process first program's loop.

    int i =1;

    while (m >=i) {

        m -=i;

        i = (i %n) +1;

    }

    // Now, process second program's step.

    // Convert m to string, replace commas with spaces.

    char m_str[20];

    sprintf(m_str, "%d", m);

    // Replace commas with spaces.

    for (int i=0; m_str[i] != '\0'; i++) {

        if (m_str[i] == ',') {

            m_str[i] = ' ';

        }

    }

    // Now, parse back to N.

    int N = atoi(m_str);

    // Now, compute the count via the recursive function.

    // Need to call aaa with "0".

    char initial[2] = "0";

    int result = aaa(initial, N);

    printf("%d\n", result);

    return 0;

}

Now, the function aaa:

int aaa(char *current, int N) {

    // Convert current to integer.

    int num = atoi(current);

    if (num > N) return 0;

    // Check if all characters are 3/5/7 and all three are present.

    int has3 =0, has5=0, has7=0;

    int valid =1;

    for (int i=0; current[i] != '\0'; i++) {

        char c = current[i];

        if (c != '3' && c != '5' && c != '7') {

            valid =0;

            break;

        }

        if (c == '3') has3=1;

        else if (c == '5') has5=1;

        else if (c == '7') has7=1;

    }

    int ans =0;

    if (valid && has3 && has5 && has7) {

        ans =1;

    }

    // Now, append each of '7', '5', '3' and recurse.

    // Create new strings for each.

    char new_str[20];

    // For '7':

    strcpy(new_str, current);

    strcat(new_str, "7");

    ans += aaa(new_str, N);

    // For '5':

    strcpy(new_str, current);

    strcat(new_str, "5");

    ans += aaa(new_str, N);

    // For '3':

    strcpy(new_str, current);

    strcat(new_str, "3");

    ans += aaa(new_str, N);

    return ans;

}

The final C code would be:

#include <stdio.h>
#include <string.h>

int aaa(char *current, int N) {
    int num = atoi(current);
    if (num > N) return 0;
    int has3 = 0, has5 = 0, has7 = 0;
    int valid = 1;
    for (int i = 0; current[i] != '\0'; i++) {
        char c = current[i];
        if (c != '3' && c != '5' && c != '7') {
            valid = 0;
            break;
        }
        if (c == '3') has3 = 1;
        else if (c == '5') has5 = 1;
        else if (c == '7') has7 = 1;
    }
    int ans = 0;
    if (valid && has3 && has5 && has7) {
        ans = 1;
    }
    char new_str[20];
    // Append '7'
    strcpy(new_str, current);
    strcat(new_str, "7");
    ans += aaa(new_str, N);
    // Append '5'
    strcpy(new_str, current);
    strcat(new_str, "5");
    ans += aaa(new_str, N);
    // Append '3'
    strcpy(new_str, current);
    strcat(new_str, "3");
    ans += aaa(new_str, N);
    return ans;
}

int main() {
    int n, m;
    scanf("%d %d", &n, &m);
    int i = 1;
    while (m >= i) {
        m -= i;
        i = (i % n) + 1;
    }
    char m_str[20];
    sprintf(m_str, "%d", m);
    for (int i = 0; m_str[i] != '\0'; i++) {
        if (m_str[i] == ',') {
            m_str[i] = ' ';
        }
    }
    int N = atoi(m_str);
    char initial[2] = "0";
    printf("%d\n", aaa(initial, N));
    return 0;
}
